page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT IN GENERAL
page.content: As in many parts of the UK in the '80's employment is a problem. In a rural area this is added to by lack of public transport, so people without their own vehicle have to rely on car sharing or to working for companies who provide buses to pick up their staff from sur- rounding villages. Barningham has a daily Eastern Counties Bus Service, if unreliable, Market Weston does not. Even so work is available if the will & intiative is there. There is season- al work in farming, fruit & potato picking etc. There is a local loyalty in giving work to the many small businesses & self employed people in the villages. For many it is necessary to travel to the larger villages such as Stanton where there are industrial estates or to the towns & cities, some commuting as far as London.
